notesStmt.note: The first leaf of the first quire is missing.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Festival prayer book (maḥzor) for Rosh ha-Shanah, Ashkenazi rite.

collation.p: 18 quires: i(10-1) (folios 1-9), ii-xviii(10) (folios 10-179). There are catchwords at the end of the quires. Quires are numbered with Latin letters starting at the end of the codex with ‘a’.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square, punctuated, of the last quarter of the 14th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Binding of the Bibliotheca Butleriana: light brown leather, tooled, with the coat of arms of the Bibliotheca Butleriana. Spine: 'Mahzor. New Year's Feast. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Bibl. Butl. Add. Or. 11,830.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Samuel Butler (b. 1774, d. 1839), headmaster and bishop of Coventry and Lichfield: his sale catalogue, Payne & Foss, 1841, no. 550, purchased by the British Museum: inscribed (folio [180v]).
